results.abstract: Ohio's Dem US Sen race between Sen Howard M Metzenbaum and former astronaut John H Glenn Jr seen extremely close; 2 contenders engage in personal attacks on each other although they assert they are focusing on 'issues'; some polls favor Glenn while others, including pro-Glenn Cleveland Plain Dealer, give Metzenbaum edge; candidates' advisers predict relatively low voter turnout, which apparently would favor Metzenbaum because he has support of official state Dem orgn and backing of such powerful labor unions as UAW; Metzenbaum also has support of urban blacks although Glenn has made inroads in black community and has gained support from rank-and-file labor union members; campaign described; Metzenbaum has said that if he loses it will probably be because of '69 tax return he filed in which he did not pay any taxes; recent TV debate between 2 contenders ended in sharp personal attacks (M)

headline.main: CAMPAIGN IN OHIO VIEWED AS CLOSE; Low Turnout Predicted

results.snippet: Ohio's durable reputation for gutpunching, rough-and-tumble politics has survived intact in a hotly contested race between Senator Howard M. Metzenbaum and John H. Glenn Jr., who are seeking the Democratic nomination. for the. United States Senate in...
results.lead_paragraph: Ohio's durable reputation for gutpunching, rough-and-tumble politics has survived intact in a hotly contested race between Senator Howard M. Metzenbaum and John H. Glenn Jr., who are seeking the Democratic nomination. for the. United States Senate in Tuesday's state primary.

results.abstract: John H Glenn Jr, former astronaut, scores stunning victory over US Sen Howard Metzenbaum on May 7 in Ohio primary for Dem nomination for US Sen; partial tally; Glenn victory comes despite fact that Metzenbaum was supported by Dem Gov John J Gilligan and by organized labor and Ohio Dem orgn; in other primary races, Gilligan, as expected, easily defeats James Nolan, token opponent, in Dem gubernatorial primary; former Gov James A Rhodes handily defeats State Repr Charles Fry for Repub gubernatorial designation; Cleveland Mayor Ralph J Perk wins Repub senatorial nomination and will face Glenn; illustrations of Glenn and Metzenbaum (L)

headline.main: Glenn Wins in Ohio Over Metzenbaum; Glenn Beats-Metzenbaum In OhioSenate Primary Glenn Making Inroads Replaced Saxbe Television Blitz

results.snippet: John H. Glenn Jr., the former astronaut, scored a stunning victory yesterday over Senator Howard M. Metzenbaum in the Ohio state primary for the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate. John H. Glenn Jr. leaves voting booth in Columbus,...

byline.original: By WILLIAM E. FARRELLSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: John H. Glenn Jr., the former astronaut, scored a stunning victory yesterday over Senator Howard M. Metzenbaum in the Ohio state primary for the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate. John H. Glenn Jr. leaves voting booth in Columbus, Ohio Senator Howard M. Metzenbaum greeting first-graders at the Malvern School in Cleveland yesterday.

headline.main: Glenn Likely Victor In Ohio's Primary

headline.main: News Summary and Index; The Major Events of the Day International National Metropolitan Energy General CORRECTION The Other News Quotation of the Day

results.snippet: In a national atmosphere of shock over the unexpected resignation of Chancellor Willy Brandt Monday night, the governing Social Democratic party of West Germany named Finance Minister Helmut Schmidt to succeed him. Mr. Brandt's decision appeared to...
results.lead_paragraph: In a national atmosphere of shock over the unexpected resignation of Chancellor Willy Brandt Monday night, the governing Social Democratic party of West Germany named Finance Minister Helmut Schmidt to succeed him. Mr. Brandt's decision appeared to be final, but for the time being, he said, he will not resign as head of the party.

results.abstract: article revs John H Glenn Jr's successful campaign against Sen Howard M Metzenbaum for Ohio Dem US Sen nomination; cites his stress on Watergate scandals and Pres Nixon's tax woes and his frequent references to Metzenbaum's tax situation and his prodding Metzenbaum to follow his lead and make income tax returns public; develand pol observers see Glenn victory linked to his success in convincing voters that Metzenbaum made extensive use of tax shelters; Glenn's loss to Metzenbaum in '70 Dem primary and his subsequent shift from amateur to professional campaign orgn recalled; Glenn apparently also received windfall of votes from Repubs who crossed over and voted in Dem primary, mainly out of disgust at Watergate; is considered favorite in race with Repub candidate Mayor Ralph J Perk; his victory is source of chagrin for Gov John J Gilligan, who endorsed Metzenbaum at prodding of UAW and other unions, but did not actively stump for him; Gilligan, Glenn and other Dem leaders begin exchanging phone calls and expressions of party unity on May 8, but Metzenbaum has decided not to endorse Glenn immediately; Gilligan wins own primary race easily and will face Repub ex-Gov James A Rhodes, who wins handily over State Repr Charles Fry; Ohio House majority whip Richard F Celeste and State Sen Tony Hall, whom Gilligan endorsed, win nominations for Lt Gov and Sec of State respectively; Dem Ronald M Mottl and Repub George E Mastics win primary races for US HR seat being vacated by Repub Repr William E Minshall; incumbent Reprs James V Stanton, Louis Stokes and Charles A Vanik are easy victors in 3 Dem Cong primaries; Glenn illus (M)

headline.main: VICTORY BY GLENN LINKED TO IMAGE; Special to The New York Times

results.snippet: John H. Glenn Jr., who defeated Senator Howard M. Metzenbaum by nearly 100,000 votes in yesterday's Democratic Senatorial primary, spent the long months of his campaign deploring the moral climate that fostered the Watergate scandals and President...
results.lead_paragraph: John H. Glenn Jr., who defeated Senator Howard M. Metzenbaum by nearly 100,000 votes in yesterday's Democratic Senatorial primary, spent the long months of his campaign deploring the moral climate that fostered the Watergate scandals and President Nixon's tax woes and calling for a return to integrity in government.

results.snippet: Brig. Gen. Earl W. Brannon Jr., U.S.A.F., retired a physician who served on the medical support team for the first United States manned space flight, died last Friday. He was 53 years old.

headline.main: Proposal for Human Colonies in Space Is Hailed by Scientists as Feasible Now; Proposal for Colonies in Space Hailed by Scientists as Feasible For a Vacation Water and Hydrocarbons

results.snippet: A conference of physicists, astronauts and space flight technologists discussed last week the likelihood that it is now possible and, in fact, desirable to establish self-sufficient human colonies in space.
results.lead_paragraph: A conference of physicists, astronauts and space flight technologists discussed last week the likelihood that it is now possible and, in fact, desirable to establish self-sufficient human colonies in space.

results.abstract: Physicists, astronauts and space flight technologists meeting at Princeton Univ discuss likelihood that it is presently possible, and desirable, to establish self-sufficient human colonies in space; initial goal of such effort would be to construct 'small' colony of approximately 2,000 people at site along orbit of moon known as L5 liberation point, 1 of 5 points in space where gravitation fields of earth and moon balance each other so that object would tend to remain there rather than falling toward either body; initial station would be built using space shuttle and space tug systems presently under development; would take advantage of abundant bldg materials available on moon and 1 of 2 novel cargo-launching systems to export such materials from moon; Dr Gerard K O'Neill, Princeton physics prof, notes 'virtually unlimited' resources exist in space and that sunlight provides constant source of free energy with no nighttime interruption; notes asteroid belt contains chunks of pure nickel and iron that can be fabricated into steel with minimal processing; initial colony would require transport of 10,000 tons of material from earth and fabrication of cylinder 200 meters in diameter and 100 meters long, which would rotate once every 20 sees to simulate earth gravity; other features of colony described; diagram of proposed site of space colony (L)

headline.main: Proposal for Human Colonies in Space Is Hailed by Scientists as Feasible Now; Proposal for Colonies in Space Hailed by Scientists as Feasible For a Vacation Water and Hydrocarbons

results.abstract: Edwin E Aldrin Jr, 2d astronaut to walk on moon and current natl mental health chmn, cancels scheduled speech at Dist of Columbia Mental Health Assn because of recurring symptoms of mental depression that developed after his Apollo 11 flight; assn dir of communications John Perry says Aldrin is receiving medication and undergoing therapy (S)

headline.main: Mental Depression Is Cited as Aldrin Forgoes a Speech

results.snippet: -Edwin E. Aldrin Jr., the second astronaut on the moon who is now national mental health chairman, canceled a scheduled speech yesterday because of recurring symptoms of mental depression that developed after his Apollo 11 journey.
results.lead_paragraph: -Edwin E. Aldrin Jr., the second astronaut on the moon who is now national mental health chairman, canceled a scheduled speech yesterday because of recurring symptoms of mental depression that developed after his Apollo 11 journey.
